Game Settings
 • Stocks: 4
 • Timer: 8 minutes
 • Items: Off
 • Pause: Off
 • Handicap: Off
 • Damage Ratio: 1.0
 • Friendly Fire: On
Select the winner of the RPS match
may choose to have first stage strike or port selection priority
will be granted the remaining option.
Players take turns striking starter stages following the striking order, until one stage remains
Players may request to RPS for port selection priority and/or use neutral ports

The winner of the previous game bans a stage first (except in a best of 5) and then the loser picks a remaining stage. In a best of 5, players do not ban stages (i.e. the loser simply picks a stage). If any player wishes to switch characters, the winner picks their character first allowing the loser to counter pick with their character choice afterwards.

Each game, players may choose a different controller port. If players cannot agree on who gets to use which port, then the player with port selection priority chooses first. Port selection priority is decided via RPS, except in Game 1, where it is automatically granted to the player who did not get first stage strike). \n \nEach game, players may also request for the use of neutral ports only. If both port selection priority and neutral ports are invoked, then the player with port selection priority chooses a neutral port first and the other players uses the remaining neutral port.
